title: Product of Row and Column Vectors
text: To multiply a row and column vector, multiply the corresponding components in the row vector by the same component in the column vector. Then, add the components together.

title: Limitations
text: We can only multiply a row and column if they have the same number of components.

title: Dot product
text: The product of a row $$n-vector$$ and column $$n-vector$$ is the same formula as the dot product between the row vector transposed and the column vector.

title: Transpose and Vector Values
text: The transpose does not change the values in the vector, but only changes the operation used.

title: Taking the Transpose
text: What is the transpose of the row vector as a column vector?

title: Calculating Dot Product
text: To take the dot product of two column vectors, multiply the first, second, etc. components of both vectors and add the pairs of components.
